workflow.name: Extract meeting tasks from Google Docs to GoHighLevel CRM with GPT-4
workflow.description:
## AI Meeting Task Manager - Google Meet to GoHighLevel CRM

---

## üìã TEMPLATE DESCRIPTION

**Transform your meeting follow-ups from chaos to clarity!**

This workflow automates the entire post-meeting workflow by scanning Google Meet recordings folders, extracting action items from AI-generated meeting notes, and creating tasks directly in your GoHighLevel CRM.

**üéØ Who is this for?**
- Sales teams using GoHighLevel CRM
- Agency owners managing multiple client meetings
- Anyone who uses Google Meet with Gemini note-taking
- Professionals drowning in meeting follow-ups

**‚ú® What it does:**

1. **Daily File Organization**
   - Scans your Google Meet recordings folder
   - Automatically sorts recordings, notes, and chat logs into organized subfolders
   - Keeps your Drive clean and searchable

2. **AI-Powered Task Extraction**
   - Reads Google Docs meeting notes (generated by Gemini)
   - Identifies action items assigned to you
   - Intelligently determines due dates from context (defaults to 3 business days)

3. **CRM Integration**
   - Searches for meeting participants in GoHighLevel
   - Creates properly formatted tasks with full context
   - Links tasks to the correct contact record

4. **Beautiful Email Summaries**
   - Sends a professionally designed HTML email
   - Shows tasks created per contact
   - Includes due dates and status updates

**üîß Technologies Used:**
- Google Drive API (file management)
- Google Docs API (content extraction)
- GoHighLevel API (contact search + task creation)
- OpenAI GPT-4 (task extraction intelligence)
- Gmail API (email delivery)

**‚öôÔ∏è Setup Requirements:**
- Google Cloud OAuth credentials (Drive, Docs, Gmail)
- GoHighLevel OAuth credentials
- OpenAI API key
- Create 4 Google Drive folders (source + 3 destination folders)

**üìñ Setup Instructions:**

1. **Create Google Drive Folders:**
   - Source folder: Where Google Meet saves recordings
   - Recordings folder: For video files
   - Notes folder: For Gemini notes
   - Chat folder: For meeting chat logs

2. **Configure Credentials:**
   - Connect Google Drive OAuth
   - Connect Google Docs OAuth
   - Connect GoHighLevel OAuth
   - Connect Gmail OAuth
   - Add OpenAI API key

3. **Update Folder URLs:**
   - Replace placeholder URLs in Google Drive nodes with your folder URLs

4. **Customize:**
   - Set your email address in the Gmail tool
   - Set your GoHighLevel user ID for task assignment
   - Adjust the schedule trigger timing as needed

**üí° Pro Tips:**
- Works best with Google Meet's Gemini note-taking feature
- Customize the AI prompts to match your task naming conventions
- The HTML email template is fully customizable

workflow.name: AI Meeting Task Manager - Extract Action Items from Google Meet Notes to CRM

parameters.text:
=Here are the meeting notes to process. Extract all action items assigned to me (Leo) and create tasks in GoHighLevel for the appropriate contact.

---

MEETING NOTES:

{{ $json.summary }}

---

Instructions:
1. Identify who I met with from the meeting title/content
2. Search for that contact in GoHighLevel
3. Create individual tasks for each action item I need to complete
4. If there's a timeframe mentioned, use it for the due date. Otherwise default to 3 business days from today.

Today's date: {{ $now.format('yyyy-MM-dd') }}

options.systemMessage:
You are a task extraction and organization assistant. Your job is to process meeting notes and create actionable tasks in GoHighLevel for follow-up.
Your workflow:

Analyze the meeting notes provided to you. Focus on:

The "Suggested next steps" section (primary source of tasks)
Any commitments, promises, or action items mentioned throughout
Deadlines or timeframes mentioned


Identify the contact from the meeting title or notes content. The meeting title format is typically "[Name] & [Name] - [Meeting Type] - [Date]". Extract the external participant's name (not "Leo") and use the FIND CONTACT IN GHL tool to search for them. Search by first name, last name, or full name.
Create tasks using the CREATE TASKS IN GHL tool for each action item. For each task:

contactId: Use the contact ID returned from your search
title: Clear, actionable task title (start with a verb)
dueDate: If a timeframe is mentioned, calculate the date. If no timeframe is specified, set it for 3 business days from now. Use ISO 8601 format.
body: Include context from the meeting notes - what was discussed, why this task matters, any relevant details



Task extraction guidelines:

Extract tasks assigned to Leo (the user), not tasks for the other party
Be specific - "Follow up on email setup" is better than "Follow up"
If multiple tasks exist, create them separately
Skip vague items that aren't truly actionable

Example task creation:
From notes saying "Leo Lara will send Barry Hill a text message when the info and the Barry emails are working":

Title: "Text Barry when email setup is complete"
Body: "Per 11/30 meeting: Confirm user@example.com and user@example.com are both working, then text Barry to confirm."

If you cannot find a matching contact, still list the tasks you would have created so the user can manually assign them.

parameters.title: ={{ $fromAI('Title', ``, 'string') }}
parameters.contactId: ={{ $fromAI('Contact_ID', 'The GHL contact ID to attach this task to', 'string') }}

parameters.text:
=Here are the results from processing today's meeting notes. Summarize what was done and send me an email update.

---

ORGANIZATION AGENT OUTPUT:

{{ $json.output }}

---

Compose and send an email summary showing:
1. Which contacts had tasks created
2. What tasks were created  
3. When they're due
4. Any issues or failures

Use the SEND EMAIL TO LEO tool to send the email.

Today's date: {{ $now.format('yyyy-MM-dd') }}

options.systemMessage:
You are a summary and reporting assistant. Your job is to analyze the Organization Agent output and send Leo an email summary using the SEND EMAIL TO LEO tool.

**What to extract from the output:**
- Date: Today's date formatted nicely (e.g., "December 2, 2025")
- Meeting_Count: How many meetings were processed
- Status_Message: "All tasks created successfully" or describe any issues
- Contact_Sections: HTML blocks for each contact (the tool description shows the exact format)

**For Contact_Sections, generate one HTML block per contact:**
- Replace CONTACT NAME with the person's name
- Replace COMPANY with their company (or "No company")
- Replace X with task count
- Replace DATE with due date (e.g., "Dec 5")
- Replace TASK_ROWS with a row for each task
- Replace TASK TITLE with the actual task title

**Subject line format:**
‚úÖ Meeting Tasks Created: [Primary Contact Name] ([Total Task Count] tasks) - [Short Date]

**Important:** 
- Use the SEND EMAIL TO LEO tool to send the email
- The HTML template is already in the tool - just fill in the dynamic parts

parameters.message:

üìã Task Summary

{{ $fromAI('Date', 'Todays date formatted like December 2 2025', 'string') }} ‚Ä¢ {{ $fromAI('Meeting_Count', 'Number of meetings processed', 'string') }} meeting(s) processed

‚úì {{ $fromAI('Status_Message', 'Brief status like All tasks created successfully or Issues occurred', 'string') }}
{{ $fromAI('Contact_Sections', 'For each contact generate HTML using this exact format per contact:

CONTACT NAME

COMPANY ‚Ä¢ X tasks ‚Ä¢ Due DATE

TASK_ROWS
where TASK_ROWS uses this format per task:
‚úì

TASK TITLE

Generated by Organization Agent ‚Ä¢ Tasks synced to GoHighLevel

parameters.subject: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Subject', ``, 'string') }}

parameters.content:
## ü§ñ AI Meeting Task Manager

**What this workflow does:**
Automatically extracts action items from Google Meet notes and creates tasks in GoHighLevel CRM, then emails you a beautiful summary.

**How it works:**
1. üìÖ Runs daily to scan your meeting records folder
2. üìÅ Organizes files into Recordings, Notes, and Chat folders
3. üîç Extracts content from Google Docs meeting notes
4. ü§ñ AI Agent identifies action items and creates CRM tasks
5. üìß Sends you an HTML email summary

**Setup Required:**
- Google Drive OAuth credentials
- Google Docs OAuth credentials
- GoHighLevel OAuth credentials
- Gmail OAuth credentials
- OpenAI API credentials

**Customize:**
- Update folder URLs in Google Drive nodes
- Set your email in the Gmail tool
- Set your GoHighLevel user ID for task assignment

## üìÅ File Organization

This section scans your Google Meet recordings folder and sorts files:
- **Recordings** ‚Üí Recordings folder
- **Notes by Gemini** ‚Üí Notes folder  
- **Chat logs** ‚Üí Chat folder

‚öôÔ∏è **Setup:** Replace the folder URLs with your own Google Drive folders

## ü§ñ AI Task Extraction

The Organization Agent:
1. Reads meeting notes
2. Finds the contact in GoHighLevel
3. Creates tasks with proper due dates

‚öôÔ∏è **Customize:** Update the system prompt to match your task naming conventions

## üìß Email Summary

Sends a beautifully formatted HTML email with:
- Meeting count processed
- Tasks created per contact
- Due dates
- Status of operations

‚öôÔ∏è **Setup:** Change the email address in the Gmail tool

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
